class.name: RWResource
class.description: A Resource that contains an [RWLock]. A Read Write Lock is used to synchronize multiple [Thread]s. This guarantees that only one thread can ever acquire the write lock at a time, and gives any number of threads read access in the meantime. An RWLock can be used to protect a critical section; however, be careful to avoid deadlocks.

method.name: read_lock
method.description: Locks the [RWLock] for read access, blocks until it is unlocked by the current owner. [b]Note:[/b] This function returns without blocking if the thread already has ownership of the rwlock.

method.name: read_try_lock
method.description: Tries locking the [RWLock] for read access, but does not block. Returns [constant OK] on success, [constant ERR_BUSY] otherwise. [b]Note:[/b] This function returns [constant OK] if the thread already has ownership of the rwlock.

method.name: read_unlock
method.description: Unlocks the [RWLock] for read access, leaving it to other threads. [b]Note:[/b] If a thread called [method lock] or [method try_lock] multiple times while already having ownership of the rwlock, it must also call [method unlock] the same number of times in order to unlock it correctly.

method.name: write_lock
method.description: Locks the [RWLock] for write access, blocks until it is unlocked by the current owner. [b]Note:[/b] This function will deadlock if the thread already has ownership of the rwlock!

method.name: write_try_lock
method.description: Tries locking the [RWLock] for write access, but does not block. Returns [constant OK] on success, [constant ERR_BUSY] otherwise. [b]Note:[/b] This function returns [constant ERR_BUSY] if the thread already has ownership of the rwlock.

method.name: write_unlock
method.description: Unlocks the [RWLock] for write access, leaving it to other threads.
